examples: the various benefits will be dependent on length of service

adjective.description: Requiring someone or something for financial, emotional, or other support.
examples: an economy heavily dependent on oil exports

adjective.description: (of a clause, phrase, or word) subordinate to another clause, phrase, or word.

noun.description: A person who relies on another, especially a family member, for financial support.
examples: a single man with no dependents

origin: Late Middle English dependant hanging down, from Old French, present participle of dependre (see depend). The spelling change in the 16th century was due to association with the Latin participial stem dependent-.
